member.name: M:Roslyn.Diagnostics.Analyzers.CSharp.Performance.LinqAnalyzer.IsTypeWithInefficientLinqMethods(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Diagnostics.SyntaxNodeAnalysisContext,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CSharp.Syntax.ExpressionSyntax,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeSymbol,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeSymbol)
member.summary:
The Enumerable.Last method will only special case indexable types that implement . Types which implement only will be treated the same as IEnumerable{T} and go through a full enumeration. This method identifies such types.
At this point it only identifies directly but could easily be extended to support any type which has an index and count property.

This method attempts to normalize out the difference between extension and non-extension method invocations. It will return the non-extension method form of the and the which corresponds to the first argument of that particular form of the method

member.name: M:Roslyn.Diagnostics.Analyzers.CSharp.Performance.LinqAnalyzer.IsSingleParameterLinqMethod(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeSymbol)
member.summary: Is this a method on which takes only a single parameter?
member.remarks: Many of the methods we target, like Last, have overloads that take a filter delegate. It is completely appropriate to use such methods even with . Only the single parameter ones are suspect

member.summary: Get the TypeInfo value for the argument passed to Enumerable.Last. This method needs to account for both extension method syntax and direct call syntax

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Performance.CSharpEmptyArrayDiagnosticAnalyzer
member.summary: Provides a C# analyzer that finds empty array allocations that can be replaced with a call to Array.Empty.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Performance.CSharpEmptyArrayDiagnosticAnalyzer.s_expressionKinds
member.summary: The kinds of array creation syntax kinds to be analyzed. We care about ArrayCreationExpression (e.g. "new byte[2]" or "new byte[] { 1, 2, 3 }") and ArrayInitializerExpression (e.g. "byte[] arr = { }"), but not ImplicitArrayCreationExpression, because you can't have an implicitly typed array of length 0 (e.g. "new[] { }" is erroneous).

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Performance.CSharpEmptyArrayDiagnosticAnalyzer.RegisterSyntaxNodeAction(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Diagnostics.CompilationStartAnalysisContext)
member.summary: Called once at compilation start to register actions in the compilation context.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Performance.CSharpEmptyArrayCodeFixProvider
member.summary: Provides a code fix for the EmptyArrayDiagnosticAnalyzer.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Performance.CSharpEmptyArrayCodeFixProvider.GetArrayType(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxNode)
member.summary: Gets the ArrayTypeSyntax from a syntax node representing an empty array construction.
member.returns: The ArrayTypeSyntax if it could be extracted; otherwise, null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Performance.CSharpEmptyArrayCodeFixProvider.InvokeStaticGenericParameterlessMethod(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamedTypeSymbol,System.String,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CSharp.Syntax.TypeSyntax)
member.param: The type on which to invoke the static method.
The name of the static, parameterless, generic method.
the type to use for the method's generic parameter.
